screen.title: Overview of all projects
screen.summary: Overview of projects with code in Launchpad
screen.callout: The darker the project's name, the more active it is. The larger its name, the more branches it has hosted in Launchpad.
Smaller, lighter text indicates a smaller, less active project.

screen.title: Viewing a project's branches
screen.summary: All of a project's branches are visible on one page
screen.callout: Any Launchpad user can register a branch against a project.
Some branches are created specifically to fix a bug. The bug icon is a link to the bug that this branch fixes.
Each of these branches represents a major version - or series - of the project.
Official project branches are listed side by side with individual developer branches.

screen.title: History of a branch
screen.summary: Each branch's history is available, complete with the developer's commit message.
screen.callout: Any Launchpad user can browse the full branch history, with diffs, and subscribe to receive email notifications of updates.
Commits to this branch are restricted to members of the team that owns it. Anyone can create their own branch, though, and make changes there.
Recent branch revisions, with the developer's commit message, give an overview of recent activity.
Launchpad automatically links to related branches.
